intro: Astenolobium, commonly known as the evergreen hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plants are characterized by their large, showy flowers that typically have five petals and a prominent central stamen. They often have broad, lance-shaped leaves and are evergreen in their natural habitat. Astenolobium species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are commonly cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
